hero.eyebrow: THE INTERNET'S NEW HOME FOR LATINO IDENTITY
hero.headline: Your culture. Your domain.
hero.subhead: .latino is the new top-level domain built for the Latino community worldwide. Claim your corner of the internet that speaks your language, represents your heritage, and amplifies your voice.
why.title: Why .latino?
why.subtitle: More than a domain — it's a digital declaration of identity.
whyLatino.feature1.title: Cultural Identity
whyLatino.feature1.desc: A domain that instantly signals Latino heritage, culture, and community. Your URL becomes a statement of pride.
whyLatino.feature2.title: SEO Advantage
whyLatino.feature2.desc: Stand out in search results with a memorable, keyword-rich domain that tells the world exactly who you are.
whyLatino.feature3.title: Community Trust
whyLatino.feature3.desc: Join a network of Latino businesses, creators, and organizations building the digital future together.
whyLatino.feature4.title: Bilingual by Nature
whyLatino.feature4.desc: Perfect for English, Spanish, Portuguese, and multilingual sites — .latino transcends borders and languages.
whyLatino.feature5.title: Brand Authority
whyLatino.feature5.desc: Differentiate your brand with a domain that carries cultural weight and modern credibility.
whyLatino.feature6.title: Built-in Security
whyLatino.feature6.desc: Every .latino domain supports HTTPS encryption and modern security standards from day one.
who.title: Who is .latino for?
who.subtitle: Whether you're building a brand, a movement, or a community — .latino is your digital home.
whoIsItFor.audience1.title: Latino-Owned Businesses
whoIsItFor.audience1.desc: From bodegas to tech startups — .latino tells customers you're part of the community before they even click.
whoIsItFor.audience2.title: Creators & Influencers
whoIsItFor.audience2.desc: Musicians, artists, chefs, podcasters — your domain should be as memorable as your content.
whoIsItFor.audience3.title: Nonprofits & Community Orgs
whoIsItFor.audience3.desc: Serve the community with a domain the community recognizes and trusts.
whoIsItFor.audience4.title: Media & Publications
whoIsItFor.audience4.desc: News, magazines, podcasts — reach 60M+ U.S. Latinos and 650M+ worldwide with a domain that resonates.
brands.title: Imagine the possibilities
brands.subtitle: Premium .latino domains for every industry and passion.

timeline.title: The road to .latino
timeline.subtitle: Registration opens in phases — sign up to be first in line.
timeline.phase1.label: Phase 1
timeline.phase1.name: Trademark Sunrise
timeline.phase1.desc: Priority registration for verified trademark holders through the Trademark Clearinghouse (TMCH).
timeline.phase2.label: Phase 2
timeline.phase2.name: Early Access
timeline.phase2.desc: Premium early registration open to all. Secure high-value domains before general availability.
timeline.phase3.label: Phase 3
timeline.phase3.name: Limited Registration
timeline.phase3.desc: Expanded access with standard pricing. First-come, first-served for available .latino domains.
timeline.phase4.label: Phase 4
timeline.phase4.name: General Availability
timeline.phase4.desc: Open to everyone worldwide. Register through any accredited registrar at standard pricing.
partners.title: Get your .latino domain from trusted partners
partners.subtitle: When registration opens, you'll be able to register your .latino domain through these accredited registrars.

faq.title: Frequently asked questions
faq.a1: .latino is a new top-level domain (TLD) created specifically for the global Latino community. Just like .com or .org, it's the ending of a web address — but .latino instantly signals cultural identity, heritage, and community connection.
faq.a2: Anyone! .latino is open to individuals, businesses, organizations, and creators worldwide who identify with or serve the Latino community. There are no geographic restrictions.
faq.a3: We're currently in the pre-launch phase. Registration will open in stages — beginning with a Trademark Sunrise period, followed by Early Access, Limited Registration, and General Availability. Sign up for notifications to be the first to know.
faq.q4: How much will a .latino domain cost?
faq.a4: Pricing will vary by registrar and registration phase. Early access periods may carry premium pricing, while General Availability will offer standard market rates. Sign up for our mailing list to receive pricing details when announced.
faq.a5: While .lat serves the broader Latin American region as a geographic identifier, .latino is designed specifically for the global Latino community and diaspora — including the 63M+ Latinos in the United States and communities worldwide. It's about cultural identity, not just geography.
faq.q6: Can I use .latino for a website in any language?
faq.a6: Absolutely. While .latino celebrates Latino heritage, your website can be in any language — English, Spanish, Portuguese, or any other. The domain represents identity, not a language restriction.
faq.a7: Yes. All .latino domains support modern HTTPS encryption standards. Your website will be secure and trusted from day one — no extra fees required for basic SSL/TLS protection.
faq.q8: Where will I be able to register a .latino domain?
faq.a8: When registration opens, .latino domains will be available through major accredited registrars including GoDaddy, Namecheap, Cloudflare, and others. Sign up for notifications to stay updated.
faq.q9: Can I transfer an existing website to a .latino domain?
faq.a9: Once .latino is live, you can register a .latino domain and point it to your existing website, or fully migrate. Standard DNS and domain transfer processes apply through your registrar.
faq.a10: The .latino TLD is operated by Dish DBS Corporation. For registry-level inquiries, contact us through the form on this website.
